snippet.title: Big data: A double-edged sword
snippet.description: New information will improve our health and prevent crimes, but uncover skeletons and hurt privacy.

snippet.title: The White House finally has an online privacy policy you can probably understand
snippet.description: New White House online privacy policy strips out the legalese.

snippet.title: White House updating online privacy policy
snippet.description: A new Obama administration privacy policy released Friday explains how the government will gather the user data of online visitors to WhiteHouse.gov, mobile apps and social media sites, and it clarifies that online comments, whether tirades or tributes, are in the open domain.

snippet.title: The Recap: Janet Yellen says full economic recovery could take hold by 2016
snippet.description: Other financial news from the week includes China's 7.4% growth rate, which represents a 24-year low.

snippet.title: Dutch man's case linked to Amanda Todd
snippet.description: Canadian police confirmed an arrest has been made in the Netherlands in the case of a Canadian teenager who was blackmailed into exposing herself in front of a webcam. The 15-year-old later committed suicide after detailing her harassment on a YouTube video watched by millions around the world.

snippet.title: Facebook rolls out location-sharing feature
snippet.description: Facebook users in the U.S. will soon be able to see which of their friends are nearby using a new feature the company is launching on Thursday.

snippet.title: Facebook rolls out 'Nearby Friends,' a real-time friend tracker
snippet.description: Now you can track your Facebook friends in real-time. But only if you want to.

snippet.title: The zealots win again
snippet.description: Disclosure of political contributors leads to witch-hunts.

snippet.title: Progressives are wrong about the essence of the Constitution
snippet.description: Progressives don't understand that it's about security liberty.

snippet.title: Away from The Post, a pro-NSA counterdemonstration
snippet.description: Away from The Post, one columnist holds a counter-demonstration.
